text.div:
CrcTumourStageT

Lists the options for Colorectal cancer tumour stage T

Copyright Statement: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright Â© 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement

This value set includes codes from the following code systems:

  • Include these codes as defined in http://snomed.info/sct
    CodeDisplay
    373200003pT1: Tumour invades submucosa (colon/rectum)
    395706002pT2: Tumour invades muscularis propria (colon/rectum)
    395707006pT3: Tumour invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa or into non-peritonealized pericolic or perirectal tissues (colon/rectum)
    384612007pT4a: Tumour directly invades other organs or structures (colon/rectum)
    384613002pT4b: Tumour penetrates visceral peritoneum (colon/rectum)
  • Include all codes defined in http://fhir.hl7.org.au/fhir/rcpa/CodeSystem/crc-tumour-stage-t

name: CrcTumourStageT
description: Lists the options for Colorectal cancer tumour stage T

concept.display: pT3: Tumour invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa or into non-peritonealized pericolic or perirectal tissues (colon/rectum)
pT4a: Tumour directly invades other organs or structures (colon/rectum)

contains.display: pT3: Tumour invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa or into non-peritonealized pericolic or perirectal tissues (colon/rectum)
pT4a: Tumour directly invades other organs or structures (colon/rectum)
TX Primary tumour cannot be assessed
T0 No evidence of primary tumour
Tis Carcinoma in situ: intraepithelial or invasion of lamina propria
